bar-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the custom scrollbar

thumb-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the thumb of custom scrollbar

content-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea

content-active-style.desc: Object with CSS properties and values for styling the container of QScrollArea when scroll area becomes active (is mouse hovered)

visible.desc: (Desktop only) Manually control the visibility of the scrollbar; Overrides default mouse over/leave behavior

delay.desc: When content changes, the scrollbar appears; this delay defines the amount of time (in milliseconds) before scrollbars disappear again (if component is not hovered)

horizontal.desc: Register for horizontal scroll instead of vertical (which is default)

scroll.desc: Emitted when scroll information changes (and listener is configured)

ref.desc: Vue reference to the QScrollArea which triggered the event

verticalPosition.desc: Vertical scroll position (in px); available only if QScrollArea is NOT in horizontal mode

verticalPercentage.desc: Vertical scroll percentage (0.0 < x < 1.0); available only if QScrollArea is NOT in horizontal mode

verticalSize.desc: Vertical scroll size (in px); available only if QScrollArea is NOT in horizontal mode

verticalContainerSize.desc: Height of the container (in px); available only if QScrollArea is NOT in horizontal mode

horizontalPosition.desc: Horizontal scroll position (in px); available only if QScrollArea is in horizontal mode

horizontalPercentage.desc: Horizontal scroll percentage (0.0 < x < 1.0); available only if QScrollArea is in horizontal mode

horizontalSize.desc: Horizontal scroll size (in px); available only if QScrollArea is in horizontal mode

horizontalContainerSize.desc: Width of the container (in px); available only if QScrollArea is in horizontal mode

getScrollTarget.desc: Get the scrolling DOM element target

returns.desc: DOM element upon which scrolling takes place
Scroll position offset from top (in pixels)

setScrollPosition.desc: Set scroll position to an offset; If a duration (in milliseconds) is specified then the scroll is animated

offset.desc: Scroll position offset from top (in pixels)
